description:
'''Bambuco''' is a traditional music genre from [[Colombia]]. Its metric structure is similar to the [[Europe]]an [[waltz]] or [[polska (dance)|polska]] (not to be confused with the [[polka]]). Typically a '''bambuco''' piece is accompanied by a stylized group dance in either a {{music|time|6|8}} or {{music|time|3|4}} [[meter (music)|meter]].

Bambuco took a cultural foothold in the [[Andes|Andean region]] of Colombia and has spread in popularity throughout [[Latin America]]. The [[Festival Folclórico y Reinado Nacional del Bambuco]] in [[Neiva]] is a festival celebrating bambuco music.

"[[Cuatro Preguntas]]" is one of the most famous songs in the genre, having been included by ''[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]]'' at No. 8 on its list of the 50 best Colombian songs of all time.
